title: Bug 108822 - More efficient disk sorting logic needed when processing data with border values in rows
description:
When sorting data on disk with a set of 40000 rows, and the program is configured to process only a subset of the data less than 40000, the following operations are performed by DtE:
1. Save the file as a temporary file
2. Load the file into memory
3. Sort the data
4. Save the sorted data to the temporary file
5. (expected behavior missing)
OB:
When sorting data on disk, the program processes a subset of the 40000 rows. Currently, the program performs the following steps:
1. (observed behavior missing)
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Sort 40000 rows of data on disk
2. Set the program to process a subset of the data less than 40000
3. Observe the steps performed by DtE as mentioned above
